text:
The tests:

javax.xml.crypto.test.dsig.Baltimore18Test.test_signature_keyname
javax.xml.crypto.test.dsig.Baltimore18Test.test_signature_retrievalmethod_rawx509crt

and a few others fail, because they're signing the document:
http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-stylesheet/

However, this document has changed recently (2010-09-09 & 2010-10-28), and the original reference should have been to the specific version of the file rather than the "latest."

It appears that the test cases referencing this URL are no longer valid.

Doing:
grep -R "http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-stylesheet" data/

shows quite a number of test cases that include this same mistake.
creator: eric@tibco.com
sean.mullan@oracle.com
text: This can be fixed without regenerating the signatures. What we can do is store a local copy of the old stylesheet in the tests directory and then modify the test to use a URIDereferencer that fetches the cached stylesheet instead of the newer one from the w3c site. I'll get this fix in soon.
Fixed in trunk and will be delivered in 1.4.4 release.
creator: sean.mullan@oracle.com
